intro: Spermacoce runkii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, rounded seeds. Spermacoce runkii is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
